channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: More Than 300 People Flee Building Fire in South Korea
item.description: An eight-story commercial complex caught fire south of the nation’s capital, fire officials said.

item.title: When History Rhymes
item.description: We cover the surprising parallels between Donald Trump and a president from the past.

item.title: Johnson Grasps for Support to Remain as Speaker Ahead of House Vote
item.description: The Louisiana Republican was unanimously nominated as his party’s candidate for speaker. But resistance among right-wing lawmakers and his slim majori...

item.title: Saudi Arabia and U.A.E. Tread Cautiously With Syria’s New Leaders
item.description: The two Mideast powerhouses have been trying to block the rise of Islamist groups in the region for two decades. The rebel takeover in Damascus will t...

item.title: Live Updates: South Korean Officials Thwarted in Attempt to Detain President After Standoff
item.description: Police officers and investigators tried to bring President Yoon Suk Yeol in for questioning about his declaration of martial law last month.

item.title: Biden Plans to Block Takeover Bid of U.S. Steel by Japan’s Nippon
item.description: The president’s announcement of the fate of the iconic Pennsylvania-based company, which became a contentious political issue in an election year, is ...

item.title: A Long Fight to Keep a Closer Eye on Madrasas Unravels in Pakistan
item.description: In a deal with Islamist parties, Pakistan is abandoning a requirement that religious seminaries, long seen by Western officials as a potential threat,...

item.title: What is Turo, the car-sharing app used in two deadly New Year’s Day attacks?
item.description: Turo has said that the individuals involved did not have criminal backgrounds that would have identified them as security threats.

item.title: Biden Plans to Block Takeover Bid of U.S. Steel by Japan’s Nippon

item.title: Why US tech ends up being controlled by European regulation
item.description: Also: Meta leadership switch, economists worry Trump will slow U.S. economy, Tesla shares slump.

item.title: Iconic Brompton bike maker suffers 99% profit decline amid post-Covid bike industry turmoil
item.description: Profits fell to just £4,600 last year as the foldable bike brand fought copycat competitors and falling demand.

item.title: Norway accelerates towards full electrification as 89% of new cars go electric
item.description: Electric vehicles surged to 89% of Norway’s new car sales last year, bringing the nation closer to its 2025 target for full electric mobility.

item.title: Garbage truck stuck in a sinkhole downs power in Omaha for several hours
item.description: The sinkhole is more than 10 feet (3 meters) deep and a number of utility lines were exposed when the hole formed at an alley entrance.

item.title: Nikki Glaser Wants to Kill as Host of the Globes. Is She Overthinking It?

item.title: How Congress Could Find Itself Paralyzed, and New Orleans Attack Update
item.description: Plus, Kenyan villagers get a scare from space.
